result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. John F Olcott

records.addlTxt:
Defendant John F Olcott not in court.  Attorney Mackenzie Renner in court for John F Olcott.  Prosecuting attorney Samuel Thomas Berg in court for the State of Wisconsin. Authorization to be filed. Offer and counter offer, requesting 30 days. If not resolved, set for trial. Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for December 2, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Scheduling Order will be provided to Attys via e-filing by the Court

Defendant John F Olcott in court.  Attorney Mackenzie Renner in court for John F Olcott.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court inquired if victim wished to be heard; no statement made. Defendant given complaint; charges/penalties explained by the court. Not guilty plea entered by counsel and trial reserved. Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for John F Olcott
Current: 207 South Road, Genoa City, WI 53128 United States  (Effective: 08-03-2022)
Prior: 5614 Highway 11 Trailer 20E, Elkhorn, WI 53121
Signed bond filed with the court.

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH E.T.K. dob 11-4-2001 OR RESIDENCE. If defendant and victim(s) are living together, defendant may go to their residence once with a police officer to retrieve the defendant's personal belongings. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

Defendant John F Olcott in court, in custody by video. Andrew Herrmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Mackenzie Renner appeared. Court inquired if victim wished to be heard; no statement made. Defendant qualifies for SPD. Signature bond set. Minutes filed.
Hearing scheduled for August 9, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
